In effect, a zone of silence surrounds the poor
of Rural America, the tools we are using to
communicate with those people are pitifully
inadequate.
When we decided to recommend that 0E0 relate to
the mass communications media, we realized that
two choices were open for consideration.
The one choice requires that equipment for
a mass communications system be purchased,
that licenses and clearances for channels
be applied for through the proper agencies,
that those facilities be staffed with
adequate, professional personnel, and
that one, or two demonstration systems be
created somewhere in the country and funded
for a reasonable length of time.
The second choice is to relate to an already
existing capability in mass communications,
to undertake contractual agreements with
those facilities for, equally, reasonable
lengths of time.
